required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relapse-Prevention Study With Levomilnacipran ER (F2695 SR) in Patients With Major Depressive Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-Controlled, Relapse-Prevention Study With F2695 SR in Patients With Major Depressive Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Levomilnacipran ER relative to placebo in the prevention of depression relapse in patients with major depressive disorder (MDD).

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who demonstrate improvement in depressive symptoms at the end of the initial 12-week open-label treatment period with Levomilnacipran ER are randomized to continue Levomilnacipran ER or switch to placebo under double-blind conditions for up to 24 weeks of additional treatment.

primary_outcome.description: Number of days until patients meet relapse criteria. Relapse was defined as 1 or more of the following: 1. MADRS total score of at least 22 at 2 consecutive visits 2. Increase of 2 or more points in CGI-I score compared with the CGI-I score at Visit 9 at 2 consecutive visits 3. Premature discontinuation due to insufficient therapeutic response 4. MADRS item 10 score of at least 4

arm_group.description: 40, 80 or 120 mg/day Levomilnacipran ER capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.
Matching placebo capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.

intervention.description: Drug: Levomilnacipran ER (40, 80 or 120 mg/day) Study drug is to be given orally, in capsule form, once daily.
Matching placebo to be given orally, in capsule form, once daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women, 18-65 years old
- Currently meet the DSM-IV-TR criteria for Major Depressive Disorder
- The patient's current depressive episode must be at least 4 weeks in duration
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are pregnant, women who will be breastfeeding during the study, and women with childbearing potential who are not practicing a reliable method of birth control
- Patients with a history of meeting DSM-IV-TR criteria for:
- any manic or hypomanic episode
- schizophrenia or any other psychotic disorder
- obsessive-compulsive disorder
- Patients who are considered a suicide risk

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patient were recruited over a 10-month period from March of 2010 to January of 2011 at 36 studies sites, 30 in the United States and 6 in Canada.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients began with a 12-week open-label treatment period, followed by a 24-week double-blind treatment period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.

group.title: Levomilnacipran ER
group.description: 40, 80 or 120 mg/day Levomilnacipran ER capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.

baseline.population: The Baseline Participant population is based on the 734 enrolled patients who received at least one dose of open-label treatment.

group.title: Open Label Levomilnacipran ER
group.description: 40, 80 or 120 mg Levomilnacipran ER capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.

outcome.title: Time to Relapse (Days)
outcome.description: Number of days until patients meet relapse criteria. Relapse was defined as 1 or more of the following: 1. MADRS total score of at least 22 at 2 consecutive visits 2. Increase of 2 or more points in CGI-I score compared with the CGI-I score at Visit 9 at 2 consecutive visits 3. Premature discontinuation due to insufficient therapeutic response 4. MADRS item 10 score of at least 4
outcome.population: The double blind Intent-to-treat population consists of 342 randomized participants who received study drug and were evaluated for the Primary Outcome Measure

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.

group.description: 40, 80 or 120 mg Levomilnacipran ER capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.

measure.title: Time to Relapse (Days)
measure.description: Number of days until patients meet relapse criteria. Relapse was defined as 1 or more of the following: 1. MADRS total score of at least 22 at 2 consecutive visits 2. Increase of 2 or more points in CGI-I score compared with the CGI-I score at Visit 9 at 2 consecutive visits 3. Premature discontinuation due to insufficient therapeutic response 4. MADRS item 10 score of at least 4
measure.population: The double blind Intent-to-treat population consists of 342 randomized participants who received study drug and were evaluated for the Primary Outcome Measure

measurement_list.measurement: Relapse did not occur within the 24-week time frame of the study
Relapse did not occur within the 24-week time frame of the study

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data was collection over a 20-month period from March 2010 to November 2011 at 36 study sites in the U.S and Canada.
reported_events.desc: The Serious Adverse Event data presented here is for the safety population. The Other Adverse Event data presented here is for the safety population during the 24 week double-blind treatment period.

group.title: Open Label Levomilnacipran ER
group.description: 40, 80 or 120 mg Levomilnacipran ER capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.

group.title: Placebo - Double Blind Treatment
group.description: Matching placebo capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.

group.title: Levomilnacipran ER - Double Blind Treatment
group.description: 40, 80 or 120 mg Levomilnacipran ER capsules, oral administration, once daily dosing.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: All data generated in this study will be the property of Forest Research Institute, Inc. An integrated clinical and statistical report will be prepared at the completion of the study. Publication of the results by the Investigator will be subject to mutual agreement between the Investigator and Forest Research Institute, Inc.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This was a failed study. The lower than expected rate of relapse in the placebo group compromised the projected power to demonstrate a difference between groups.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Carl Gommoll, MS, Sr. Dir. Clinical Development Psychiatry
